name: Data Description and Preparation
content:
Data Description

The dataset consists of transactional records with the following features:

  • date (Temporal, Daily granularity) – Represents the transaction date, ranging from 01-01-2013 onwards.
  • store (Categorical, Integer ID) – Identifies the store location.
  • item (Categorical, Integer ID) – Identifies the product sold.
  • sales (Numerical, Continuous) – The quantity of items sold on the given date in a specific store.

Granularity: Daily sales at the store-item level.

Coverage: Multiple stores and items across the observed time period.

Variables: 4 columns – 2 categorical (store, item), 1 temporal (date), 1 numerical (sales).

Data Preparation

1.Data Cleaning

  • Handle missing dates by imputing with zero sales where applicable.
  • Detect and correct anomalies such as unusually high sales spikes.

2.Feature Engineering

  • Time-based features: day of week, month, year, holidays, seasonality indicators.
  • Lag features: previous day/week sales.
  • Rolling features: moving averages (7-day, 30-day).
  • Store/item attributes: encoding categorical identifiers.

3.Data Transformation

  • Convert date column to proper datetime format.
  • Normalize or scale features (where required for machine learning models).
  • Aggregate to weekly/monthly levels for alternative forecasting granularity.
